circumstances: After takeoff from Chicago-Merrill C. Meigs, while climbing, both engines failed simultaneously. The pilot lost control of the airplane that stalled and crashed into Lake Michigan. The aircraft was lost and the pilot, sole on board, was killed.
probable_cause:
Complete failure of both engines due to fuel exhaustion. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Inadequate preflight preparation, 
- Mismanagement of fuel,
- Fuel exhaustion,
- Failure of both engines, 
- Improper operations of flight controls, 
- Fuel drained total less than two gallons from each wing,
- Right wing hit first and aircraft cartwheeled.
